subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Check out what I broke this time
author: Robin Searcy Henson
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0017_01C84FF5.5BBBDF40
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Thanks for sharing Misty.  I feel a little better now knowing I'm not the o=
nly one, but DARN!  

Robin

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Misty =
Dawn<mailto:bulletbabea@...> 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups.com> 
  Sent: Saturday, January 05, 2008 10:47 PM
  Subje=
ct: Re: [EVP-ITC] Check out what I broke this time



  Wow Robin you gave =
me flashbacks LOL. Dont feel bad. Same thing happened to me except it didnt=
 even fly out of my hands, the hack seemed to go fine, but when I went to p=
ut it back together the wire came undone from the battery casing so he went=
 to his friends house and resoldered it on for me brought it back put it in=
 my hands for me to put the screws in and I noticed now there was a big bla=
ck wire from the speaker section undone as well. He then went back to his f=
riends resoldered that wire, brought it back, I put it together and powers =
up, scans fine...manual...auto...BUT there are no stations being picked up =
at all. LOL

  Worked fine before I touched it (reception wise) but now its=
 sittin in a box waitin for me to mail it to Franks radio graveyard soon as=
 I get my butt in gear now that the holiday mail rush is coming to an end. =
He said he can probably fix it. I bet he can LOL its probably just another =
wire come undone I didnt see underneath. Or somethin i did wrong. I aint op=
ening it again they will all fly off at me or somethin if i do LOL. Or he c=
an rip it to shreds for the parts. Gonna leave the building to the builders=
. Mike just had to go and make it look so dang easy I couldnt resist tearin=
g one apart hehehe

  And tear it apart I did =3D)

  Misty


  joel smith =
<sparky1j41@...> wrote:
    you can buy new leads  at rs  for like` $=
2.00  and get it to work

    Robin Henson <MudPuddleFarm@...> wrote: 
=
      After viewing Mike's RS 12-469 hack video for the fifth time I felt 
=
      ready to take the plunge myself, so yesterday while dh was picking up=
 
      a pizza at Papa John's I sneaked next door and bought the radio. He=
 
      couldn't stop complaining about how I'd wasted money on a perfectly=
 
      good piece of equipment only to wreck it for my dumb hobby, but onc=
e 
      we got home he took it upon himself to test it and make sure it 
 =
     worked. For some reason it really DIDN'T work, so he took it back to 
=
      RS and exchanged it for another one, and after making sure THAT one 
=
      worked he even offered to help me with the modification. "No thanks" =

      I told him. "I think I need to do this myself." 

      I can't pret=
end the process went as smoothly as I'd hoped, but 
      finally I was don=
e and making the last turn in the second screw of 
      the circuit board.=
. and then.. The whole thing flew out of my hands 
      and both battery w=
ires ripped away from their soldered ends in the 
      casing. It was all =
Bob could do to keep from gleefully yelling "I 
      knew you were going t=
o break it!" But then I guess he felt bad 
      because he ran down to Wal=
mart and got a soldering iron and solder 
      and spent an hour trying to=
 put it all back together for me. 

      It's dead as a doornail, and I'm =
thinking that if I could break it 
      that easily without even knowing h=
ow or why, maybe I'm not supposed 
      to pursue this method (sigh). I gu=
ess I'll just think it over and 
      maybe try again later. 

      Thank=
s for all the helpful information though Mike!

      Robin
